tldr: Q2 2025 beat outlook with ~$1.3B sales (+6%), non-GAAP EPS of $3.61, and modest margin expansion despite tariffs. Management announced the pending $1.3B Elo Touch Solutions acquisition and raised full-year sales, EBITDA margin, EPS, and free cash flow guidance.
bullets: Sales rose about 6% to $1.3B with adj. EBITDA margin of 20.6% and non-GAAP EPS of $3.61 (+14% YoY).
Full-year sales growth guidance raised to 5% to 7% and EPS to $15.25 to $15.75.
Announced $1.3B acquisition of Elo Touch Solutions, expected to be immediately accretive.
themes: Rugged device demand broadening across retail and logistics
RFID momentum supporting asset visibility wins
Guidance raise signals healthier channel demand

segments.title: Regional performance
points: North America +8% with double-digit mobile computing and RFID growth.
Asia Pacific +20% led by Australia, New Zealand, and India; Latin America +11%.
EMEA -1% due to tough prior-year comparisons.

segments.title: Product and vertical trends
points: Mobile computing, scanning, and RFID outperformed; transportation and retail led vertical growth.
Manufacturing remained softer; healthcare cycled strong compare.

segments.title: Elo acquisition
points: Elo brings point-of-sale, kiosks, and touchscreen solutions to expand the connected frontline portfolio.
Management expects $25M of annual EBITDA synergies by year three and immediate accretion.

notes.title: Tariffs and pricing
points: Full-year gross profit impact after mitigation reduced to about $30M.
Annualized impact now ~$40M, aided by lower China import rates and pricing actions.

notes.title: Capital allocation
points: Repurchased $250M of stock year to date.
Balance sheet supports pending $1.3B Elo acquisition.

themes.title: Elo strategic fit
points: Elo adds customer-facing devices and expands TAM by about $8B.
Zebra expects cross-sell opportunities and broader geographic reach.

themes.title: Demand and guide balance
points: Management said demand stayed resilient but customers remain cautious on trade policy.
Guide reflects backlog visibility and balanced second-half assumptions.

top_questions.question: How does Elo overlap with Zebra and what is the customer synergy?
top_questions.summary: Overlap is minimal; Elo adds self-service and POS solutions with cross-sell potential.

top_questions.question: What is embedded in second-half demand guidance?
top_questions.summary: Backlog and pipeline support the guide; customers are cautious but executing plans.

top_questions.question: How do tariffs and pricing flow through margins?
top_questions.summary: Tariff impact improved; pricing is holding outside mobile computing where exemptions apply.

implications: Elo acquisition shifts Zebra toward broader connected-frontline workflows and customer-facing endpoints.
Improved tariff outlook provides margin relief and increases full-year EPS visibility.
competitive_notes: Elo operates in a fragmented market with strong IP and long-standing customer relationships.
forecast_hooks: Track Q3 margin performance vs. tariff assumptions and FX headwinds.
Monitor deal close timing and early integration signals for Elo.

action_items: Validate Elo cross-sell opportunities in retail, hospitality, and healthcare channels.
Track RFID demand and transportation logistics momentum into Q3.
open_questions: How quickly will Elo synergies ramp toward the $25M target?
Will pricing realization improve if tariff exemptions change?
watch_next_quarter: Q3 sales growth delivery vs. 2% to 6% guide.
Updates on Elo closing, integration planning, and tariff mitigation progress.
